title: [FEAT] Create a server action for decrypting shares and piecing all the shares together
body:
- Utilize pre existing decryption modules for decrypting private key share 1, 2 and 3 
- Piece the decrypted shares together in the order of: aesShare, awsShare and gcpShare respectively 
- Return the share that got pieced together as one 

Please take an updated pull

This will be a wrapper function which is called whenever a transaction has to be signed, to get a decrypted private key
author: cb7chaitanya

comments.body: Can I work on this issue?
Yep yep pick it up @rahulbarmann

title: [FEAT] Coupling splitting service with AWS and GCP KMS modules
body:
- Take an updated pull to get the modified schema file 
- Utilize the already existing Splitting service to split the private key and KMS modules to encrypt share number 2 & number 3 
- Store those shares in the respective database fields in the user table 
- This goes without saying but to do this, you need to configure KMS, you can refer to the docs I have listed out in the Readme

Do tell if you want to do both KMS or just one

title: feat: add aes-256-cbc module

# Feat: Add AES-256-CBC Module

Added an AES-256-CBC encryption Module which is an Advanced Encryption Standard with a 256-bit key in Cipher Block Chaining (CBC) mode. This module would be used to encrypt and decrypt one of the user's shares.

title: feature: Improve CI/CD workflows
body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
Currently, the CI CD workflows are trivial.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
It would be great to include various additional workflows, for example pointing out library vulnerabilities, auto approval of linting, code quality checks and additional convenience for maintainers.

I am willing to raise a PR and already have the code locally ready for the workflow revamp.
author: pawann-2000

comments.body:
> **Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.** Currently, the CI CD workflows are trivial.
> 
> **Describe the solution you'd like** It would be great to include various additional workflows, for example pointing out library vulnerabilities, auto approval of linting, code quality checks and additional convenience for maintainers.
> 
> I am willing to raise a PR and already have the code locally ready for the workflow revamp.

would love to know the specifics 

as it is in early stages , what we can do to improve the CI/CD flow will appreciate more clarity

Sure, here is the plan of action I have,

1. Implementing code scanning for security vulnerabilities.
2. Secret scanning to avoid accidental secret key pushes. (can be ruled out but nice to have)
3. Implement dependabot to upgrade dependencies from time to time, this offloads some weight from developers to manually upgrade the deps.
4. Approve pull requests on a reaction or text (can be also ruled out but is helpful from a maintainer's perspective).

> @pawann-2000 but suppose somebody pushes secret key and the cicd fails and we close the pr but anyone can see the closed pr from pr history Its good to improve pr but i think we should also introduce a script which will scan the code to avoid security vurnerability And give us a warning before pushing the code

Yes, that's what I have as plan 2
@pawann-2000 Please start with this and make a PR, we can go from there
Roger, will keep you guys posted
@pawann-2000 any update on this?

**for Code-scanning. only**
we can user Semgrep because it is an efficient and open-source tool that fits well into our project for several reasons.
Fast & Lightweight

Customizable : for example ~  if you want to prevent developers from using console.log in production code, or ensure that certain security checks are always included, you can write a custom rule in a .semgrep.yml file.

Language Support
Free & Open-source

Easy Integration via github actions
Cool, you can get on it @vishutyagi0210
Hey @cb7chaitanya , can we use sonarcloud here, and can i work on it
Haven't used it before, do send some docs on it @Gmin2

Hi @ArpitBlagan,

Could you please pull the latest changes and resolve the conflicts? Since you've already raised this pull request and Husky is needed for the workflow, it would be great if you could fix the conflicts so that @cb7chaitanya can merge this PR as soon as possible.

Having Husky in place will help us avoid minor issues related to linting and formatting, as these checks will become part of the Git commit and push hooks. This will ensure that any incorrect or minor linting issues are caught early on and donâ€™t get committed.

Thanks for your help!

i have added a pr of eslint so in future if we use eslint will prettier override eslint??
if doesnt do can you add that ? @Riya267

> i have added a pr of eslint so in future if we use eslint will prettier override eslint?? if doesnt do can you add that ? @Riya267

Yes, Prettier and ESLint can sometimes conflict depending on the rules and plugins you use. To prevent conflicts and ensure consistent formatting, you should integrate Prettier as a plugin in your ESLint configuration. This setup ensures that Prettier and ESLint complement each other effectively.
once your pr is merged i will surely add prettier as a plugin into eslint file. no worries.

title: Update CONTRIBUTING.md to be Clearer, More Concise, and Beginner-Friendly
body:
Our current **CONTRIBUTING.md** file contains valuable information, but it could benefit from being more clear, concise, and beginner-friendly. This would help encourage more contributions from new developers and ensure that everyone understands the contribution process.

A more organized, clear, and beginner-friendly CONTRIBUTING.md file that lowers the barrier to entry for new contributors and provides all necessary information in a concise manner.

title: Docker file doesn't seems right and I think we also need to first create a migration file.
author: ArpitBlagan

comments.body: What exactly, please point it out and you can work on this after that @ArpitBlagan

> What exactly, please point it out and you can work on this after that @ArpitBlagan

1. As in current docker file there is a line RUN npm run dev  I think we dont' need this and we need to put this in cmd CMD ["npm","run","dev"] because this is an command which will be keep listening to in coming requests for our app and docker file use to build the image and we don't need to run this npm run dev during the build.

2.  We need to deploy the migration file of prisma  on db before starting the app and also need to add health check for db in our docker compose so that if the db container is health then we execute the command for our app container.
